intro: Zygia fagifolia, commonly known as the maple-leaf zygia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its palmate leaves with five to seven lobes. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Zygia fagifolia is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along riverbanks. Its ornamental value has led to its cultivation in some horticultural settings.
